title: How Do I Delete My Messenger Account on Android?

steps.title: Open Messenger on your Android.
steps.content: Open Messenger on your Android. It’s the blue chat bubble icon with a white lightning bolt inside. You’ll usually find it on the home screen or in the app drawer. You can remove an account from Messenger if another account is logged in. If there is only one Messenger account in the app, you won't have the option to delete it.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . You'll see this three-line menu icon in the top left corner of your screen.

steps.title: Tap your profile photo.
steps.content: Tap your profile photo. It’s at the top-left corner of the screen and prompts all the Messenger accounts you have on your Android to drop down.

steps.title: Swipe left on the account you want to remove.
steps.content: Swipe left on the account you want to remove. Drag your finger from the right side of the screen to the left, and more options will appear on the right. You must keep at least one account linked to Messenger on your Android. You won't be able to remove an account if it's the only one signed in.

steps.title: Tap the red trash can.
steps.content: Tap the red trash can. A confirmation message will appear.

steps.title: Tap Remove to confirm.
steps.content: Tap Remove to confirm. This removes the account from Messenger on this Android. You can still use this account to sign into Messenger on any Android at any time. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open Messenger on your Android using the account you want to mute.
steps.content: Open Messenger on your Android using the account you want to mute. It’s the blue chat bubble icon with a white lightning bolt inside. You’ll usually find it on the home screen or in the app drawer. Change your profile by tapping your profile picture and then the profile you want to use. This method won't get rid of the account on your Android, but you will no longer get notifications from that Messenger profile. Use this method if you have an account on Messenger that you can't delete, like a page account.

steps.title: Tap your profile picture.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture. It's in the top left corner.

steps.title: Tap Notifications & sounds.
steps.content: Tap Notifications & sounds . It's next to the purple bell icon under the "Preferences" header.

steps.title: Tap the switch next to "On" to toggle it off .
steps.content: Tap the switch next to "On" to toggle it off . It will be grey and pointing left if the feature is disabled. This toggle will say "Off" if it's already off.

steps.title: Select how long you want notifications muted.
steps.content: Select how long you want notifications muted. Tap an option to fill in the circle, then tap OK . You can also tap the toggle next to "Show notification dot" if you do not want a visual indication of activity on that Messenger account. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open Settings on your Android.
steps.content: Open Settings on your Android. Swipe down, then tap the gear or app icon that features a gear. This method removes the Messenger account from your phone and gets rid of the Facebook account tied to that Messenger account.

steps.title: Tap Accounts and backup.
steps.content: Tap Accounts and backup . The wording for this menu option varies depending on your phone's manufacturer. However, you're looking for "Accounts."

steps.title: Tap Manage accounts.
steps.content: Tap Manage accounts . You'll see a list of all the added accounts on your Android.

steps.title: Tap the Facebook account that you want to get rid of.
steps.content: Tap the Facebook account that you want to get rid of. You'll see more options.

steps.title: Tap Remove account.
steps.content: Tap Remove account . It's below all the other options. Tap Remove account if prompted. Now that account isn't associated with your Android anymore! It will only pop up if you sign into that account again.
